alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 9:10PM MDT until March 16 at 8:16AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Utah... Santa Clara River At SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE affecting Washington County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Santa Clara...including SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Clara River At SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.7 feet, At 14.7 ft, developments on the lower Santa Clara River near St. George and the St. George golf course will be threatened. Due to a large engineering effort, the Santa Clara River cannot change its course through St. George. As a result, flood damage is now limited to adjacent roads, bridges, and the St. George golf course. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Wednesday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.6 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 13.9 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 04/12/1995. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 830 AM MDT.
